greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals, where column k is the expansion of Product_{j>=1} (1 + k*x^j).
comment: A(n,k) is the number of partitions of n into distinct parts of k sorts: the parts are unordered, but not the sorts.
link: Index entries for sequences related to partitions
formula: G.f. of column k: Product_{j>=1} (1 + k*x^j).
mathematica: Table[Function[k, SeriesCoefficient[Product[(1 + k x^i), {i, 1, Infinity}], {x, 0, n}]][j - n], {j, 0, 12}, {n, 0, j}] // Flatten
Table[Function[k, SeriesCoefficient[QPochhammer[-k, x]/(1 + k), {x, 0, n}]][j - n], {j, 0, 12}, {n, 0, j}] // Flatten
results.author: _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, May 17 2017
